intro: Phacopsis praelongus, commonly known as the long-stalked phacopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, lanceolate, and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This plant is often used in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local pollinators and soil stabilization.
